Content: give a sample "Hello World!" solution in as many different programming languages as you can think of

Here are "Hello World!" solutions in as many programming languages as I can think of:

## **C**
```c
#include <stdio.h>
int main() {
    printf("Hello World!\n");
    return 0;
}
```

## **C++**
```cpp
#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

int main() {
    cout << "Hello World!" << endl;
    return 0;
}
```

## **Java**
```java
public class HelloWorld {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Hello World!");
    }
}
```

## **Python**
```python
print("Hello World!")
```

## **JavaScript**
```javascript
console.log("Hello World!");
```

## **HTML**
```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head><title>Hello World</title></head>
<body>Hello World!</body>
</html>
```

## **PHP**
```php
<?php
echo "Hello World!";
?>
```

## **Ruby**
```ruby
puts "Hello World!"
```

## **Go**
```go
package main
import "fmt"

func main() {
    fmt.Println("Hello World!")
}
```

## **Rust**
```rust
fn main() {
    println!("Hello World!");
}
```

## **Swift**
```swift
print("Hello World!")
```

## **Kotlin**
```kotlin
fun main() {
    println("Hello World!")
}
```

## **C#**
```csharp
using System;

class Program {
    static void Main() {
        Console.WriteLine("Hello World!");
    }
}
```

## **Perl**
```perl
print "Hello World!\n";
```

## **Lua**
```lua
print("Hello World!")
```

## **R**
```r
print("Hello World!")
```

## **MATLAB**
```matlab
disp('Hello World!')
```

## **Scala**
```scala
object HelloWorld {
    def main(args: Array[String]): Unit = {
        println("Hello World!")
    }
}
```

## **Haskell**
```haskell
main = putStrLn "Hello World!"
```

## **OCaml**
```ocaml
print_endline "Hello World!"
```

## **Groovy**
```groovy
println "Hello World!"
```

## **Dart**
```dart
void main() {
  print('Hello World!');
}
```

## **TypeScript**
```typescript
console.log("Hello World!");
```

## **Shell/Bash**
```bash
echo "Hello World!"
```

## **PowerShell**
```powershell
Write-Host "Hello World!"
```

## **Fortran**
```fortran
program hello
      implicit none
      print *, 'Hello World!'
      end program hello
```

## **Pascal**
```pascal
program HelloWorld;
begin
  writeln('Hello World!');
end.
```

## **Assembly (x86-64)**
```assembly
section .data
    msg db "Hello World!", 0

section .text
    global _start

_start:
    mov rax, 1
    mov rdi, 1
    mov rsi, msg
    mov rdx, 12
    syscall
```

## **Brainfuck**
```brainfuck
++++++++++[>+++++++>++++++++++>+++>+<<<<-]>++.>+.+++++++..+++.>++.<<+++++++++++++++.>.+++.------.--------.>+.>.
```

## **Erlang**
```erlang
-module(hello).
-export([start/0]).

start() ->
    io:format("Hello World!~n").
```

## **Clojure**
```clojure
(println "Hello World!")
```

## **Scheme**
```scheme
(display "Hello World!")
(newline)
```

## **Smalltalk**
```smalltalk
Transcript show: 'Hello World!'; cr.
```

## **Objective-C**
```objective-c
#import <Foundation/Foundation.h>

int main() {
    NSLog(@"Hello World!");
    return 0;
}
```

## **Julia**
```julia
println("Hello World!")
```

## **Tcl**
```tcl
puts "Hello World!"
```

## **Groovy**
```groovy
println "Hello World!"
```

## **COBOL**
```cobol
       IDENTIFICATION DIVISION.
       PROGRAM-ID. HELLO-WORLD.
       PROCEDURE DIVISION.
           DISPLAY "Hello World!".
           STOP RUN.
```

## **Ada**
```ada
procedure Hello_World is
begin
   Put_Line("Hello World!");
end Hello_World;
```

## **Fortran 77**
```fortran
      PROGRAM HELLO
      WRITE(*,*) 'Hello World!'
      END
```

## **Logo**
```logo
print [Hello World!]
```

## **Prolog**
```prolog
:- initialization(main).

main :-
    write('Hello World!'), nl.
```

## **Elixir**
```elixir
IO.puts "Hello World!"
```

## **Crystal**
```crystal
puts "Hello World!"
```

## **Nim**
```nim
echo "Hello World!"
```

## **VBA**
```vba
Sub HelloWorld()
    MsgBox "Hello World!"
End Sub
```

## **VB.NET**
```vb
Module Program
    Sub Main()
        Console.WriteLine("Hello World!")
    End Sub
End Module
```

## **Racket**
```racket
#lang racket
(printf "Hello World!\n")
```

## **F#**
```fsharp
printfn "Hello World!"
```

## **Zig**
```zig
const std = @import("std");

pub fn main() void {
    std.debug.print("Hello World!\n", .{});
}
```

This covers a wide variety of programming paradigms and languages, from systems programming (C, Assembly) to high-level scripting (Python, JavaScript) to functional languages (Haskell, Lisp) and more!
